skill.name: doc-sync
skill.description: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify documentation accuracy after code changes, or when checking if documentation (in doc/, README.md, CONTRIBUTING.md) matches the current codebase. The skill can work bidirectionally - from docs to code verification, or from code changes to documentation updates.
skill.summary: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify docume...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: All 35 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The static analyzer misidentified markdown documentation text as security threats. SKILL.md is pure documentation containing workflow instructions and example bash commands shown as documentation - no executable code exists. The skill-report.json already correctly assessed this as safe with no risk factors.

content.user_title: Verify IdeaVim docs match code changes
content.value_statement: Documentation often drifts after code updates and creates broken examples for users. This skill provides a structured workflow to compare docs against working code and identify discrepancies.
actual_capabilities: Identify documentation targets in doc/, README.md, and CONTRIBUTING.md
Extract code examples and signatures from documentation files
Compare examples against working implementations in the codebase
Review git history for removals and breaking changes
Produce a structured documentation sync report with discrepancies
limitations: Requires access to the repository code and git history to work
Does not update docs when only internal implementation changes
Focused on IdeaVim project structure and documentation locations
Ambiguous API behavior still requires human judgment to resolve

use_cases.title: Post-release audit
use_cases.description: Confirm documentation reflects recent API changes after a release cycle completes.

use_cases.title: Doc review before PR
use_cases.description: Validate examples and parameter names before submitting documentation update changes.

use_cases.title: Regression triage
use_cases.description: Check whether reported documentation issues correspond to real API changes in code.

prompt_templates.title: Single file check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check doc/ideavim-mappings.md against current code and list any mismatches found.

prompt_templates.title: Change-based review
prompt_templates.prompt: I changed MappingScope.kt. Identify affected documentation and propose specific updates.

prompt_templates.title: Folder audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Scan all docs in a folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit all files in doc/ for outdated examples and summarize findings in a report.

prompt_templates.title: Signature audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all examples using map(), nmap(), and vmap() against current API signatures in code.

output_examples.input: Check README.md for outdated mappings examples
output: Found two examples with removed parameters in the mappings section
README.md should reference the new MappingScope name instead of old name
No other issues detected in the README file
Identified 5 API signatures that changed in release 2.0
3 parameter names in examples need updating to match new signatures
1 code block uses a deprecated method that was removed

output_examples.input: Check if CONTRIBUTING.md matches current git workflow
output: All git commands in CONTRIBUTING.md match current branch workflow
No discrepancies found between documented steps and actual git behavior

best_practices: Start with a working implementation to establish ground truth before comparing docs
Prioritize removed or renamed API elements when checking for documentation drift
Keep updates minimal and aligned with existing documentation style and terminology
anti_patterns: Updating wording when the underlying behavior is still accurate
Skipping verification of named parameters in code examples
Assuming documentation is correct without checking working implementation

faq.question: Is this compatible with any repository?
faq.answer: It is designed specifically for the IdeaVim project structure and documentation locations.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: No built-in limits, but accuracy depends on access to code and git history in the repository.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI?
faq.answer: It provides a workflow you can run manually or wrap in automated CI checks if needed.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it only reviews repository files you provide access to for documentation checking.

faq.question: What if outputs seem incorrect?
faq.answer: Recheck ground truth examples and verify API signatures directly in the source code.

faq.question: How does it compare to a linter?
faq.answer: It validates documentation logic and code examples, not code style or syntax errors.
